subject: Philosophy
title: The Greatest Good
description: A fast breakdown of The Greatest Good for builders.

hook.text: What if the right action is simply whichever one makes the most people happy?

buildup.text: That's utilitarianism â€” the most influential form of consequentialism.

discovery.text: Jeremy Bentham proposed it in the 1780s: maximize pleasure, minimize pain, for the greatest number.

twist.text: But it has a dark side. If harvesting one person's organs saves five, utilitarianism might approve.

climax.text: The results matter most, not intentions. A good heart that causes harm is still morally wrong.

punchline.text: The greatest good sounds simple. It isn't.

quiz.question: What does utilitarianism say is the right action?
options: The one that produces the most overall happiness
